description: From French flagellation, from Latin flagellatio, from flagellare, from flagellum, diminutive of flagrum (“whip”).

entries.meaning: A beating consisting of lashes, notably as corporal punishment or mortification, such as a whipping or scourging.

description: From flagellum (“elongated filiform appendage”), itself a diminutive of Latin flagrum (“whip”), closely related to etymology 1.

entries.meaning: (botany) The formation by plants of flagella, or their arrangement
